title: Michael Avenatti Embezzlement Case Ends in Mistrial; Avenatti became nationally known for representing former adult-film actress Stormy Daniels in litigation against Donald Trump
text:
The evidence involved financial data from a software used by Mr. Avenatti's firm. Prosecutors first turned it over to him on Monday, a month into the trial, according to Mr. Avenatti, who pleaded not guilty on ten charges of wire fraud and was representing himself.

"The government was on notice of the importance of this information early on in its investigation and yet did nothing to locate it and produce it," he said in court filings.

A spokesman for the U.S. attorney's office confirmed the mistrial and declined to answer further questions, including whether prosecutors would seek to retry him.

Mr. Avenatti still faces a second trial on the remaining charges in the indictment, including that he concealed assets from bankruptcy court and failed to pay taxes. He has pleaded not guilty to those charges as well.

Mr. Avenatti became nationally known through his representation of former adult-film actress Stormy Daniels in litigation against Donald Trump over a payment to silence stories of an extramarital affair by the future president in the run-up to the 2016 presidential election. Mr. Trump has denied the affair.

Earlier this month, Mr. Avenatti was sentenced in New York to two and a half years in prison after he was convicted on charges stemming from his threats to expose purported corruption in Nike Inc.'s basketball program unless the company paid him more than $20 million to conduct an internal investigation.

Mr. Avenatti is also scheduled to go to trial next year on federal charges that he embezzled money from Ms. Daniels.
